message.entry: When the range normalization method is specified, the first argument must be a real numeric or logical array, a table, or a timetable.
First argument must be a real array of type double or single, a table, or a timetable.
Invalid data type. First argument must be of type double, single, table, or timetable.
Table variables must be real numeric or logical arrays.
Table variables must be real arrays of type double or single.
Table variables must be of type double or single.
Table variables must be column vectors.
Dimension must be a positive integer.
Dimension is not supported when first argument is a table or timetable.
Incorrect number of input arguments. Parameter names and values must occur in pairs.
Parameter name must be ''DataVariables'' or ''ReplaceValues''.
''DataVariables'' function handle must return a logical scalar.
Invalid ''DataVariables'' value.
''DataVariables'' parameter is only supported for table and timetable inputs.
''ReplaceValues'' parameter is only supported for table and timetable inputs.
Incorrect number of input arguments.
Normalization method must come before Name-Value pairs.
Normalization method must be ''zscore'', ''norm'', ''center'', ''scale'', ''range'', or ''medianiqr''.
Invalid input combination. ''center'' and ''scale'' are the only methods that can be specified at the same time.
The norm must be a positive real scalar or Inf.
The range interval must be a real vector containing two elements with increasing values.
''center'' method type must be: ''mean'', ''median'', a numeric array of centering values, or a table of centering values (when the first input is a table).
''scale'' method type must be: ''std'', ''mad'', ''iqr'', ''first'', a numeric array of scaling values, or a table of scaling values (when the first input is a table).
When the ''center'' and ''scale'' method types are tables, ensure the tables have the same variable names or specify ''DataVariables'' to indicate a subset of variables to operate on.
To center and scale the data in the variables specified by ''DataVariables'', the variables must be present in the data as well as the centering and scaling tables.

When the ''center'' and ''scale'' method types are tables, ensure the table variable names are present in the data as well or specify ''DataVariables'' to indicate a subset of variables to operate on.
The zscore type must be ''std'' or ''robust''.
'DataVariables' parameter cannot contain duplicates for code generation.
